post.author: =FF=Sturm
post.body:
http://returntocastlewolfenstein.filefr ... ack;120456 (press F5 if error)
http://www.gamebanana.com/tuts/8899

???

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: What are you getting at?

post.author: =FF=Sturm
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
What are you getting at?

Didn't know that It was possible to edit a game textures "without" access to it's assets. How's that possible?

post.author: NX-317
post.body: The texmod program takes the textures from computer's memory when the game is running. Then the user edits the textures and saves them as a texmod package. After that they run texmod and the game. Texmod edits the memory, replacing the original textures with edited ones.

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body:
=FF=Sturm wrote:
Didn't know that It was possible to edit a game textures "without" access to it's assets. How's that possible?


Determination.
